title.native: 世界征服～謀略のズヴィズダー～

description:
What does it take to conquer the world?! Every leader of the past has thought of it... but all they have done was to merely dream of its greatness. World domination... nobody has been able to achieve it. Until one little girl by the name of Kate Hoshimiya came along. Kate Hoshimiya will shock the world! How was she able to carry out such a magnificent stunt? So frightful! So glorious! Could this be... the Zvezda Plot?! Let the light of our great Zvezda shine upon this land far and wide!

(Source: Aniplex USA)

tags.name: Tokusatsu
tags.description: Prominently features elements that resemble special effects in Japanese live-action shows

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Homeless
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is homeless.

tags.name: Chuunibyou
tags.description: Prominently features a character with "Middle School 2nd Year Syndrome", who either acts like a know-it-all adult or falsely believes they have special powers.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Lost Civilization
tags.description: Featuring a civilization with few ruins or records that exist in present day knowledge.

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岡村天斎) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tensai_Okamura)

During his university days at Waseda University, Okamura was a part of Waseda's manga research society and together with other budding animators, produced his first independent anime there. Upon graduating from university, Okamura joined the animation production studio Madhouse as an animator through the recommendation of a friend. Lensman was the first series he worked on as an animator. The first anime movies that he worked on were Kamui no Ken and Bobby ni Kubittake. 

In 1989, he made his debut as an episode director with Yawara! and soon made his full directorial debut in 1995 with Memories. He later left Madhouse and went freelance, working on several projects along the way.

In 1991, he changed his first name from Yutaka to Tensai.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/meteor_)
[Blog](http://kuroboshi.blog34.fc2.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kuroboshi) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/users/178217)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Sasakino00) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/佐々木啓悟F)

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). 
Previously affiliated with [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/A1-Pictures). 
Currently affiliated with [CygamesPicture](https://anilist.co/studio/6182/CygamesPictures).

__Graduated:__ Tokyo College of Music

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/cut_tatsu7) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tatsuya__kato/)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岡村天斎) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tensai_Okamura)

During his university days at Waseda University, Okamura was a part of Waseda's manga research society and together with other budding animators, produced his first independent anime there. Upon graduating from university, Okamura joined the animation production studio Madhouse as an animator through the recommendation of a friend. Lensman was the first series he worked on as an animator. The first anime movies that he worked on were Kamui no Ken and Bobby ni Kubittake. 

In 1989, he made his debut as an episode director with Yawara! and soon made his full directorial debut in 1995 with Memories. He later left Madhouse and went freelance, working on several projects along the way.

In 1991, he changed his first name from Yutaka to Tensai.

Originating from [Nippon Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/22/). Directs on rare occasions.

Worked for Square Enix in Honolulu, Hawaii together with [Yoshinori Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/) and others for the first decade of the 2000s and was completely absent from the anime industry because of this. Returned in 2011 and has been active since.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/331643934) | [Website](http://mazurka.moo.jp/)

While studying for a university degree in art, she was discovered by web artists [Shingo Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/114914/) and [Kenichi Kutsuna](https://anilist.co/staff/116007/), who recruited her to work on [Birdy Decode](https://anilist.co/anime/3974/). She did not join any particular studio, but started her career as a freelancer.

[Twitter](https://x.com/0046hi)

Freelance Japanese animator

Though he was a Physics major at Chiba University, he joined an Anime Research Club that inspired him to enter the industry. He started as a Production Assistant affiliated with [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/A1-Pictures) and gradually moved to directorial roles.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Sasakino00) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/佐々木啓悟F)

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). 
Previously affiliated with [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/A1-Pictures). 
Currently affiliated with [CygamesPicture](https://anilist.co/studio/6182/CygamesPictures).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岡村天斎) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tensai_Okamura)

During his university days at Waseda University, Okamura was a part of Waseda's manga research society and together with other budding animators, produced his first independent anime there. Upon graduating from university, Okamura joined the animation production studio Madhouse as an animator through the recommendation of a friend. Lensman was the first series he worked on as an animator. The first anime movies that he worked on were Kamui no Ken and Bobby ni Kubittake. 

In 1989, he made his debut as an episode director with Yawara! and soon made his full directorial debut in 1995 with Memories. He later left Madhouse and went freelance, working on several projects along the way.

In 1991, he changed his first name from Yutaka to Tensai.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/meteor_)

Originating from Studio Annapuru, where he worked under the supervision of [Osamu Dezaki](https://anilist.co/staff/100393/) and [Akio Sugino](https://anilist.co/staff/103064/). He went independent after leaving the studio in 1991. As a freelancer he worked on numerous works as a key animator and started quickly getting recognized as one of the strongest action animators in the industry.

In 2000, Andou made his debut as an episode director with [Medarot](https://anilist.co/anime/1138/)'s 49th episode, and started gradually shifting his focus from animating to directing and storyboarding episodes himself. He mainly worked on studio [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/)' productions in the early '00s, and got to direct several episodes of [RahXephon](https://anilist.co/anime/165/), [Wolf's Rain](https://anilist.co/anime/202/) and [Fullmetal Alchemist](https://anilist.co/anime/121/). In 2007, he directed [Sword of the Stranger](https://anilist.co/anime/2418/), a film which was also produced by Bones. He has since directed multiple shows for both Bones and [P.A. Works](https://anilist.co/studio/132/).

Noted for his action storyboards. He is also close friends with [Masahiro Satou](https://anilist.co/staff/134126/) and often works with him.

_Note: Not to be confused with older animator [Masahiro Andou](https://anilist.co/staff/155926/)._
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/namachu)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岡村天斎) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tensai_Okamura)

During his university days at Waseda University, Okamura was a part of Waseda's manga research society and together with other budding animators, produced his first independent anime there. Upon graduating from university, Okamura joined the animation production studio Madhouse as an animator through the recommendation of a friend. Lensman was the first series he worked on as an animator. The first anime movies that he worked on were Kamui no Ken and Bobby ni Kubittake. 

In 1989, he made his debut as an episode director with Yawara! and soon made his full directorial debut in 1995 with Memories. He later left Madhouse and went freelance, working on several projects along the way.

In 1991, he changed his first name from Yutaka to Tensai.
**Harada Osamu** is a Japanese animation planner.
Kouichirou Natsume is representative director & president of Aniplex company.
Representative director of [Aniplex](https://anilist.co/studio/17/). Board Director at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).
__Naohiro Tafu__ is a Japanese producer and animation planner. He currently works for the company Movic.
